docs.lead_paragraph: A Musical Farewell THURSDAY -- The Brooklyn Academy of Music will pay tribute to Harvey Lichtenstein, who is leaving his post as the academy's president and executive producer. The event, at the academy's opera house, 30 Lafayette Avenue (Ashland Place), will include performances by the singers Paul Simon and Lou Reed, the dancers and choreographers Trisha Brown and Chuck Davis, and the composer Philip Glass. Proceeds will benefit the academy's artistic, community and educational programs. After the performance, dinner will follow under tents nearby. Tickets, $600, or $50 to $100 for the cocktail reception and performance alone, from (718) 636-4174. Chinese Legacy
